body_html:
@alisidd I may be missing something in your code, but I think he meant just sending an input tensor of ones down the network. What comes out will be the tensor we want.
If we set p to 2, then both the weights and the inputs are bigger or equal to 0, so ReLU doesn't affect the products.
body_text:
@alisidd I may be missing something in your code, but I think he meant just sending an input tensor of ones down the network. What comes out will be the tensor we want.
If we set p to 2, then both the weights and the inputs are bigger or equal to 0, so ReLU doesn't affect the products.
body:
@alisidd I may be missing something in your code, but I think he meant just sending an input tensor of ones down the network. What comes out will be the tensor we want. 
If we set `p` to 2, then both the weights and the inputs are bigger or equal to 0, so ReLU doesn't affect the products.
